title: Disability Advocates Fight Disabled Governor
teaser: Bob Kafka of ADAPT says that despite the governor’s own paralysis, he has gutted programs for the disabled.
contentencoded:
For the first time since 1987, one of the nation’s governors is in a wheelchair. Texas Governor Greg Abbott won the race by promising to fight the federal government with his literal “spine of steel,” but disability advocates are saying that he hasn’t fought for them.

Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson speaks with Bob Kafka, an organizer with ADAPT, an Austin-based disability rights group. He says that despite the governor’s own paralysis, Abbott has gutted programs for the disabled and battled to keep federal aid out of Texas.

Guest

  • Bob Kafka, organizer for ADAPT of Texas, an Austin-based disabilities rights group.
